meanings.definition: Manage (something) in an excessively controlling or interfering manner.
meanings.sent1: She was overmanaging the project, checking every detail multiple times.
meanings.sent2: He tends to overmanage his team, not giving them enough freedom to make decisions.
meanings.sent3: The boss was overmanaging the office potluck, insisting on approving every dish.
meanings.sent4: Her tendency to overmanage was like trying to control the wind - impossible and frustrating.
meanings.sent5: Overmanaging the situation only led to confusion and frustration for everyone involved.

meanings.definition: The act of managing something in an overly controlling or interfering way.
meanings.sent1: His overmanaging of the project resulted in delays and discontent among the team.
meanings.sent2: The overmanaging of the budget led to unnecessary restrictions and inefficiencies.
meanings.sent3: The committee's overmanaging of the event made it feel more like a chore than a celebration.
meanings.sent4: The company's overmanaging of employee schedules stifled creativity and morale.
meanings.sent5: The negative effects of overmanaging were evident in the team's lack of motivation and enthusiasm.
